entry.title: What Is Your Security Team Profile? Prevention, Detection, or Risk Management

The post Russians hit Sloviansk with Iskander missiles, killing 3 people and wounding 6. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Verkhovna Rada dismisses ombudsman Denisova.
entry.summary: 234 lawmakers voted to dismiss Lyudmyla Denisova. Earlier, Ukrainian journalists and activists have expressed concerns over Denisova’s reports of rapes by Russian soldiers, that were sometimes seen as insensitive or disrespectful towards survivors. The post Verkhovna Rada dismisses ombudsman Denisova. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Austrian chancellor: Next package of Russia sanctions won’t include gas embargo.
entry.summary: Karl Nehammer claimed that it would be much more difficult to replace Russian gas than Russian oil. Earlier the European Union had agreed to impose an embargo on Russian oil with a “temporary exemption” for pipeline oil. European countries have faced criticism for effectively financing Russian aggression against Ukraine by […] The post Austrian chancellor: Next package of Russia sanctions won’t include gas embargo. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: General Staff: One more Russian offensive towards Sloviansk fails.
entry.summary: Ukraine’s General Staff said that Russian troops had unsuccessfully tried to storm the village of Dovhenke near Sloviansk, Donetsk Oblast. Russian troops are also trying to storm Zolote, Komyshuvakha, Nyrkove, Berestove, Pokrovske and Dolomitne near Bakhmut in Donetsk Oblast, the General Staff said. The post General Staff: One more Russian offensive towards Sloviansk fails. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Ukrainian court jails 2 Russian soldiers charged with war crimes.
entry.summary: The court sentenced the two Russians, Alexander Bobykin and Alexander Ivanov, to 11.5 years in prison for shelling residential areas in Kharkiv Oblast. The post Ukrainian court jails 2 Russian soldiers charged with war crimes. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: German defense committee chief urges Scholz to unblock supplies of armored vehicles to Ukraine.
entry.summary: Marie-Agnes Strack-Zimmermann, head of the German parliament’s defense committee, has called on German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s office to deliver 50 Marder infantry fighting vehicles to Ukraine as soon as possible. German media reported earlier that Scholz had blocked Marder supplies for weeks. The post German defense committee chief urges Scholz to unblock supplies of armored vehicles to Ukraine. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: UK Defense Ministry: Russia achieves local successes by massing forces.
entry.summary: The ministry said that the strategy of massing forces and fires in a relatively small area had enabled Russian troops to achieve local successes. In contrast, during the first month of the large-scale invasion, Russia suffered military setbacks after scattering its forces over a huge area. The ministry said that […] The post UK Defense Ministry: Russia achieves local successes by massing forces. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Prosecutor General’s Office: Russia’s war has killed 240 children, injured 436.
entry.summary: The figures are expected to be higher since they do not include child casualties in the areas where hostilities are ongoing and in the occupied areas, the Prosecutor General’s Office said. The post Prosecutor General’s Office: Russia’s war has killed 240 children, injured 436. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: US rejects Russia’s offer to unblock Ukrainian ports in exchange for lifting sanctions.
entry.summary: U.S. Department of State spokesman Ned Price called Russia’s suggestion to unblock Ukrainian ports in exchange for lifting sanctions “empty promises.” “The quickest solution to rising raw material prices and rising food prices around the world is to end the Russians’ brutal war,” Price said. The post US rejects Russia’s offer to unblock Ukrainian ports in exchange for lifting sanctions. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: World Bank President: Russia’s war in Ukraine could trigger global recession.
entry.summary: David Malpass said on May 25 that Europe, China, and the U.S. were seeing slower growth. Meanwhile, shortfalls in fertilizer, food stocks, and energy supplies hit developing countries. The post World Bank President: Russia’s war in Ukraine could trigger global recession. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: UK Intelligence: Russia’s airborne forces ‘heavily involved in several notable tactical failures in Ukraine’
entry.summary: These failures include the attempted advance on Kyiv via Hostomel Airfield in March, the stalled progress on the Izium axis since April, and the recent failed and costly crossings of the Siverskyi Donets River, according to the latest intelligence update by the U.K. Defense Ministry. The misemployment of its elite […] The post UK Intelligence: Russia’s airborne forces ‘heavily involved in several notable tactical failures in Ukraine’ appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: ISW: Russia preparing for Battle of Sievierodonetsk.
entry.summary: The Institute for the Study of War said in its May 25 assessment that the intensity of Russian artillery and air attack, combined with the massing of Russian forces from elsewhere suggests Russia may start its offensive on Sievierodonetsk prior to cutting off Ukrainian ground lines of communication. Russia “may […] The post ISW: Russia preparing for Battle of Sievierodonetsk. appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Media: NATO members informally agree not to supply Ukraine with aircraft and tanks
entry.summary: Citing its sources in NATO, the German Press Agency reported that alliance members have informally agreed not to supply the weapons to Ukraine, fearing Russia could see the delivery of Western tanks and combat aircraft as entering the war and take retaliatory measures, German newspaper Die Zeit reported. The post Media: NATO members informally agree not to supply Ukraine with aircraft and tanks appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Nike will not renew franchise agreement with Russian retailer
entry.summary: The company said in a statement that “due to operational challenges in Russia, Nike has made the decision not to renew or enter into any new business commitments,” Russian business daily Vedomosti reported. Earlier in March, Nike said it would temporarily close its Nike-owned and operated stores in Russia but […] The post Nike will not renew franchise agreement with Russian retailer appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Zelensky: ‘The world wasn’t ready for Ukrainian bravery’
entry.summary: “For the bravery of all our people who are not inferior to Russia and continue to defend our state,” President Zelensky said during his nightly address. In reference to doubts early on in the war that Ukraine would be able to withstand Russia’s full-scale war, Zelensky said many “simply did […] The post Zelensky: ‘The world wasn’t ready for Ukrainian bravery’ appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Zelensky: ‘Russia advancing aggressively in east, we need weapons’
entry.summary: In his nightly address, President Zelensky said that while Ukraine’s Armed Forces are resisting Russia’s offensives in the east, in some places Russia outnumbers Ukraine in troops and equipment. “We still need the help of partners, especially weapons for Ukraine. Full help, without exceptions, without restrictions, is enough to win,” […] The post Zelensky: ‘Russia advancing aggressively in east, we need weapons’ appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.

entry.title: Despite constant heavy shelling, Sievierodonetsk still accessible
entry.summary: Oleksandr Striuk, head of the Sievierodonetsk city military administration, said despite Russia’s constant attacks, the city is not besieged and has enough Ukrainian troops to hold back Russian forces. Striuk said power and communications systems are down and while the roads remain dangerous, “you can get to the city.” He […] The post Despite constant heavy shelling, Sievierodonetsk still accessible appeared first on The Kyiv Independent.
